SEARCH
Package com.mimecast.robin.smtp.io

Class LineInputStream

java.lang.Object
java.io.InputStream
java.io.FilterInputStream
java.io.PushbackInputStream
com.mimecast.robin.smtp.io.LineInputStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable
Direct Known Subclasses:
MagicInputStream
public class LineInputStream extends PushbackInputStream
Input stream with binary line reading capability.

InputStream implementation returns lines with EOL as byte array and counts lines.

      private static final int LF
      Line feed byte.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE

      private static final int DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE
      Default internal read buffer size (1KB - safe for default pushback buffer). Must be smaller than pushback buffer to avoid "Push back buffer is full" errors.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • LINE_BUFFER_INITIAL_SIZE

      private static final int LINE_BUFFER_INITIAL_SIZE
      Initial line buffer size (typical SMTP line is 78-998 bytes).
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • lineNumber

      private int lineNumber
      Current line number.

    • pushbackSize

      private final int pushbackSize
      Pushback buffer size from constructor (used to size internal read buffer).

    • readBuffer

      private final byte[] readBuffer
      Internal read buffer for bulk reads. Size is limited to 75% of pushback buffer to ensure unread() always succeeds.

    • bufferPos

      private int bufferPos
      Current position in read buffer.

    • bufferLimit

      private int bufferLimit
      Number of valid bytes in read buffer.

    • lineBuffer

      private final ByteArrayOutputStream lineBuffer
      Reusable line buffer to reduce allocations.

    • inUnreadOperation

      private boolean inUnreadOperation
      Flag to prevent recursive buffer pushback when PushbackInputStream delegates between unread() methods. Set to true during unread operations to avoid pushing back buffer data multiple times.

  • Constructor Details

    • LineInputStream

      public LineInputStream(InputStream stream)
      Constructs a new LineInputStream instance. Uses default pushback buffer size (1 byte from PushbackInputStream). For optimal performance, use constructor with explicit size.
      Parameters:
      stream - InputStream instance.

    • LineInputStream

      public LineInputStream(InputStream stream, int size)
      Constructs a new LineInputStream instance with given pushback buffer size. Internal read buffer is sized at 50% of pushback buffer to ensure unread() operations always succeed when pushing back buffered data + caller's line.
      Parameters:
      stream - InputStream instance.
      size - Pushback buffer size.

  • Method Details

    • getLineNumber

      public int getLineNumber()
      Gets line number.
      Returns:
      Line number.

    • readLine

      public byte[] readLine() throws IOException
      Read line as byte array.

      Optimized implementation uses internal buffering to reduce overhead. Falls back to per-byte reading if pushback buffer is active (after unread()).

      Returns:
      Byte array.
      Throws:
      IOException - Unable to read.

    • read

      public int read() throws IOException
      Overrides read() to use internal buffer when possible.

      Maintains compatibility with PushbackInputStream functionality.

      Overrides:
      read in class PushbackInputStream
      Returns:
      Byte read or -1 if end of stream.
      Throws:
      IOException - Unable to read.

    • unread

      public void unread(int b) throws IOException
      Overrides unread() to preserve internal buffer state.

      CRITICAL: Before pushing back requested bytes, must first push back any unprocessed data from internal buffer. Otherwise that data is lost forever, causing MIME parts and boundaries to be missed during parsing.

      Overrides:
      unread in class PushbackInputStream
      Parameters:
      b - Byte to unread.
      Throws:
      IOException - Unable to unread.

    • unread

      public void unread(byte[] b) throws IOException
      Overrides unread() to preserve internal buffer state.

      CRITICAL: Before pushing back requested bytes, must first push back any unprocessed data from internal buffer. Otherwise that data is lost forever, causing MIME parts and boundaries to be missed during parsing.

      Overrides:
      unread in class PushbackInputStream
      Parameters:
      b - Byte array to unread.
      Throws:
      IOException - Unable to unread.

    • unread

      public void unread(byte[] b, int off, int len) throws IOException
      Overrides unread() to preserve internal buffer state.

      CRITICAL: Before pushing back requested bytes, must first push back any unprocessed data from internal buffer. Otherwise that data is lost forever, causing MIME parts and boundaries to be missed during parsing.

      Overrides:
      unread in class PushbackInputStream
      Parameters:
      b - Byte array to unread.
      off - Offset.
      len - Length.
      Throws:
      IOException - Unable to unread.
